required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Patient Satisfaction of Miralax and Gatorade Versus Movi Prep
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 4 of Efficacy and Patient Satisfaction of Miralax and Gatorade Versus Movi Prep

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be comparing patient satisfaction, efficacy comparing miralax with gatorade versus Movi Prep for outpatient colonoscopy.

detailed_description.textblock: Study is the purpose of evaluating patient satisfaction and at the same time efficacy of the bowel regimen in cleansing the colon

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Screening

primary_outcome.description: To assess the bowel prep efficacy in cleansing the colon for colonoscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: assess change in renal function pre and post bowel prep
secondary_outcome.description: changes in electrolytes pre and post bowel preparation administration

arm_group.description: miralax with dulcolax and gatorade efficacy evaluated by colonoscopy and patient satisfaction evaluated by patient questionnaire
Efficacy of split dose moviprep on cleansing colon for colonoscopy and patient satisfaction with the regimen

intervention.intervention_name: comparing 2 drugs on their effect on the bowel preparation for colonoscopy
intervention.description: the effects of the drug on the colon preparation for colonoscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- outpatient colonoscopy for screening for other Gi related problems
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe CHF,
- CKD,
- less than age 18 or more than 80 years

reference.citation: Rex DK, Imperiale TF, Latinovich DR, Bratcher LL. Impact of bowel preparation on efficiency and cost of colonoscopy. Am J Gastroenterol. 2002 Jul;97(7):1696-700.
Hookey LC, Vanner S. A review of current issues underlying colon cleansing before colonoscopy. Can J Gastroenterol. 2007 Feb;21(2):105-11. Review.

DiPalma JA, Wolff BG, Meagher A, Cleveland M. Comparison of reduced volume versus four liters sulfate-free electrolyte lavage solutions for colonoscopy colon cleansing. Am J Gastroenterol. 2003 Oct;98(10):2187-91.
